channel.title: iOS/iPadOS on MEM v ENNBEE - Battles with Modern Device Management
channel.description: Recent content in iOS/iPadOS on MEM v ENNBEE - Battles with Modern Device Management
channel.copyright: Â© 2024 Nick Benton, MEM v ENNBEE

item.title: Assigning Intune Mobile Apps Quickly and Consistently
item.description: No one, and I mean no one, really wants to manually and individually assign Mobile Apps to Users or Devices in Intune, especially after you’ve happily used a script to Approve Managed Google Play Apps in their 100’s as part of migrating to Microsoft Intune from other below par Mobile Device Management solutions.

item.title: Updating Apple Operating System Compliance Policies
item.description: I’m not going to go over old ground in too much detail, as I’ve already covered the importance of keeping your Operating System Compliance Policies up to date in line with the release of new updates, as well as a way to update your compliance policies using Graph and PowerShell.

item.title: Device Migration and Automated Device Enrolment Profile Assignment
item.description: Now that you’ve made the financial sensible decision to migrate to Microsoft Intune for your Apple device management needs, you’ve got your Apple Push Certificate, sorted your Enrolment Token, added Intune as an MDM provider, and now you’ve got all your iOS/iPadOS devices happily sitting synchronised in Intune waiting to be deployed using Apple’s Automated Device Enrolment.

item.title: Creating and Assigning App Categories the Smart Way
item.description: Everyone likes managing clients apps in Microsoft Intune, the grind of packing Windows apps, the chore of selecting Managed Google Play apps, the joy of assigning Apple VPP app licenses in Apple Business Manager…all good fun.
